data.title: A Gem!
data.text: This is a very good meal, especially when you consider the reasonable price.  You can get a lot of food for $10-13.

data.title: Authentic food prepared on site
data.text: This small, out of the way restaurant was a surprise.  The lamb dishes were superb, well prepared and presented.  The chef said the only meats he serves are lamb and chicken, goat (dinners only), and fish if he can get it fresh.  Hot tea was a hit.  My rating for the food was "Excellent ".  The only drawback in my opinion was the restaurant 's decor, not a big deal if you are there for the food.

data.title: Always Excellent - I keep trying new things  07/29 & 30, 2016
data.text:
Can't go wrong here.  Food is always excellent!   Prepared fresh for you.  Authentic flavors.   Lamb ---- so nice to get good lamb!

  Tried the Curried Lamb on 07/29 - Terrific!

  Went back on the next day and had makloubi for the first time on 07/30; and loved it!   

  I grew up with a Lebanese family as my second family and I've never had better!

  Owner is a lovely person as well.  I hope you get a chance to try it.

data.title: Love this place!
data.text: You won't find anything like it around. The food is freshly made and delicious . Best hummus and tabbouleh !

data.title: Great coffee!
data.text: We made a point to stop at this restaurant in route to Charlottesville. The Turkish coffee is amazing, as are the little fig and pistachio desserts I had. I also had the lamb stuffed grape leaves that were made when I ordered them. BEST I've ever had.

data.title: top notch service
data.text: I called in an order to Al Ryan while visiting family. I was tired of eating standard Southern cuisine (which I love) and wanted something different. When I arrived the owner was incredibly apologetic because the baba ghanoush I'd ordered had been left out on the counter and he refused to serve anything that was less than fresh. I appreciated  both his honesty and his commitment to his product. The food was delicious, the portions were filling, and the service was top notch. I will definitely return

data.title: Nice lunch spot
data.text: Stopped in for a quick lunch. Super nice staff and owner. I had the falafel sandwich. It was a little dry, but good and fresh.  Its three kind of little local joint we should all be supporting.

data.title: Finally - Mediterranean fare in Lynchburg
data.text: We wanted to eat something that wasn't the standard fare and fortunately found Al Ryans in Main Street, Lynchburg.  It was exactly what we wanted.  True Mediterranean cuisine - from appetizer to dessert.  The owner came to meet us and was delightful - even shared his secret to his incredible basmati rice.  We'll definitely go there again.

data.title: Very impressed
data.text: I have been dying to find a Mediterranean place that I like in Lynchburg. And this is the spot! I went there for the first time and grabbed lunch take out food. The owner noticed I was a new customer, tanked me for coming and talked time about the restaurant. Very nice guy. The food was amazing! Hummus and Shawarma are what I got and I've been craving it ever since. Definitely going back!

data.title: Delicious food!
data.text: We have been a couple of times for lunch and dinner since they last re-opened and the food is great. It is a very simple place and setting, but the food is worth it. We've had this food in different parts of Europe, so I can tell you their lamb is really good! Great price as well.

data.title: Delicious Food; Great Owner
data.text: I have been to Al Ryan several times and have always been amazed at the quality and quantity of the food for the price. The owner is amazing and always comes and speaks to us and offers to do special requests. It may not look like much when you go in, but the food and service far out weigh the atmosphere!

data.title: Enjoying Authentic Mediterranean in Lynchburg!
data.text:
Its as if I have been whisked away to another land! This food is blissfully authentic and the Chai is one of the best I have had! Any of the lamb and chicken dishes will leave you wanting more! Everything tastes really fresh with good portions.
The area upstairs is also a big plus for a friendly get together. The staff is very helpful and friendly.

data.title: The Lamb Burger!
data.text: The hummus for a appetizer was a excellent choice between me and my fiancé! She is Greek and she loved it. I my self wasn't to sure about it at first, but to my surprise the lemon juice, olive oil, and some other secret ingredients my pallet just couldn't decipher. Then... The burgers! Only thing I can is if you like uniquely seasoned meat and mouth watering tastes.. This is the place to eat!

data.title: Mixed but there are some really great choices
data.text:
My wife & I love Mediterranean food and looked forward to eating here based on other reviews. We started with a 'Sampler Plate' ($8.95) that consisted of hummus, baba gahoush, 2 falafels, tabouleh and pita chips. The falafels were to die for, crispy on the outside and soft and warm inside with delightful seasonings. The baba gahoush was great, but the hummus was way too salty. Personally, we prefer warm, fresh pita to pita chips.

 My wife ordered the lamb kofta platter, and I had the lamb kebab platter. Both platters come with a huge pile of rice, lettuce with an interesting dressing laid across the middle of the plate, and then either chunks of lamb with peppers and onions (the kebab) or a ground spiced lamb patty (the kofta). My kebab meat was tender, plentiful, beautifully cooked and the peppers and onions charred just right - really delicious, but my wife's kofta patty was too salty, skimpy and missing all the lovely spices one associates with kofta - garlic, cilantro, parsley and onions. The salt simply overpowered any other flavor. The platters are $9.50

I had a cup of Turkish coffee - perfectly sweetened and aromatic with cardamon. $2.50 Recommended.

We finished the meal with pistachio baklava ($1.50). Very good but mavbe a day or so old. 

With the right choices this could be a 5+ restaurant. Go for a falafel appetizer plate and the kebab platter entree and  enjoy!

This is a tiny, rather nondescript place with only 5 tables for two crowded into the first floor and two additional tables upstairs. Also upstairs by a large window is a lovely arrangement of low divans covered in bright red middle eastern fabrics and carpets along with lots of brass and low tables. Yes, you can choose to be served in this delightful setting, according to Nayef Al Shubaki, the Jordanian owner and head chef.

While we were eating lunch there was a steady stream of folks coming in for takeout.

data.title: Great Middle Eastern Food in Lynchburg, VA
data.text: Lynchburg, VA has come a long way in terms of diversity of food.   As a foodie, I couldn't be more happy.   Al Ryan is set in the downtown area.   It's small but intimate.   You can get an excellent plate of Middle Eastern food for a very reasonable price.

data.title: A taste of the Middle East in the Mid City!
data.text: As a frequent traveller to the Middle East, I love Arabic and Mid-Eastern cuisine. These folks apparently do too! Well done and filling, affordable and different, it isi a place to which to return again and again. The hummus is fabulous, just like in Amman!

data.title: Only Mediterranean place in town
data.text: If you want Mediterranean food in Lynchburg, this is your only choice.  The food is quite good and is made fresh.  Not the largest menus selection, but better than what we had before, which was nothing!

data.title: Not enough food for the price
data.text:
After exploring downtown Lynchburg for most of the day, my date and I stopped into Al Ryan for some dinner. Based on our experience, I assume that if you plan on eating there you let them seat you. We approached the counter and ordered and they assumed we wanted our food to go. 

As for the quality of the food, it tasted great, but I didn’t feel like I got enough to warrant the price. The falafel was very good, and seemed more reasonably priced, but the lamb that I ordered came with very little lamb at all (maybe 3-4 bites). What was there was excellent, there  just wasn’t enough for a $13 price tag. There was plenty of rice so that I didn’t end up hungry in the end, but there really should have been more meat, in my opinion.

data.title: Staff seemed sort of confused...
data.text:
Charged my friend's credit card twice. They fixed the problem when he went back. He told the waitress 3 times to include his daughter's meal on his bill. The waitress didn't do that, in spite of multiple requests.
Food was okay, but not great. They don't serve beer or wine here. The man who owns the restaurant is very nice.

I doubt if I'll go back though.

data.title: Excellent & Authentic Middle Eastern Food
data.text:
Al Ryan is a real treasure with the quality and authenticity of the dishes and a very welcoming, friendly owner who puts his customers first.
  I met a Lebanese family when I was 13 and instantly fell in love with their food.   So, now that its almost 40 years later, Middle Eastern food is one of my favorites and Al Ryan is now a favorite restaurant in Lynchburg.
  When I met the owner in August, 2014, I relayed my history with my Lebanese adopted family and asked if he made several dishes that I enjoyed, including hushwa.  Although he didn't offer Hushwa on his menu, he told me he would make it for me if I gave him a day's notice.  I took him up on his offer the next week and had a great meal!  
  The owner is a great chef who also makes his own baklava; several varieties - pistachio filled, walnut filled, walnut filled with chocolate sauce.
  The Turkish coffee flavored with crushed cardamom is excellent!
  As the owner is Jordanian, he also offers their cuisine: I enjoyed the Jordanian Mansif on my last trip to Lynchburg in October, 2014.
  The downstairs seating is very small (intimate) with only 3 tables but the restaurant has an upstairs area with a table for four and a traditional Jordanian area with seating on the floor with pillows and padded backrests.
  No alcohol is served but the fruit juices are terrific!
